TIK Cheatsheet

This cheatsheet will help you write textual internationalization keys (TIKs) in the default setting for locale en.

{"..."} String

Replaces ... with an arbitrary string value.

ExampleAvoid comparing {"apples"} to {"oranges"}.
ICUAvoid comparing {var0} to {var1}
  • {"var0": "cats üêà", "var1": "dogs üêï"}
    ‚Üí
    Avoid comparing cats üêà to dogs üêï
  • {"var0": "bananas", "var1": "anything really"}
    ‚Üí
    Avoid comparing bananas to anything really

{7} Integer

Represents an integer number value.

ExampleYour number is {3}
ICUYour number is {var0, number, integer}
  • {"var0": 42}
    ‚Üí
    Your number is 42
  • {"var0": 0}
    ‚Üí
    Your number is 0

{3.14} Number

Represents a decimal number value.

ExampleIt's off by {3.14} degrees.
ICUIt's {var0, number} degrees.
  • {"var0": 42}
    ‚Üí
    It's off by 42 degrees.
  • {"var0": 0.628}
    ‚Üí
    It's off by 0.628 degrees.

{"2 ..."} Cardinal Pluralization

Pluralizes ... to the correct CLDR plural form.

ExampleYou have {2 unread messages} in {2 groups}.
ICUYou have {var0, plural, one{# unread message} other{# unread messages}} in {var1, plural, one{# group} other{# groups}}}
  • {"var0": 4, "var1": 1}
    ‚Üí
    You have 4 unread messages in 1 group
  • {"var0": 1, "var1": 1}
    ‚Üí
    You have 1 unread message in 1 group

{4th} Ordinal Pluralization

Represents a CLDR ordinal plural value.

ExampleYou are {4th} in the queue.
ICUYou are {var0, selectordinal, one{#st} two{#nd} few{#rd} other{#th}} in the queue.
  • {"var0": 1}
    ‚Üí
    You are 1st in the queue.
  • {"var0": 9}
    ‚Üí
    You are 9th in the queue.

{They} Gender

Represents a gender subject.

them
their
theirs
themself
Example{They} received the message!
ICU{var0, select, male{He} female{She} other{They}} received the message!
  • {"var0": "male"}
    ‚Üí
    He received the message
  • {"var0": "female"}
    ‚Üí
    She received the message
  • {"var0": "neutral"}
    ‚Üí
    They received the message

{7/16/99} Date Short

Represents a CLDR short date.

ExampleToday is {7/16/99}
ICUToday is {var0, date, short}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is 1/26/25
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is 9/2/98

{Jul 16, 1999} Date Medium

Represents a CLDR medium date.

ExampleToday is {Jul 16, 1999}
ICUToday is {var0, date, medium}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is Jan 26, 2025
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is Sep 2, 1998

{July 16, 1999} Date Long

Represents a CLDR long date.

ExampleToday is {July 16, 1999}
ICUToday is {var0, date, long}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is January 26, 2025
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is September 2, 1998

{Friday, July 16, 1999} Date Full

Represents a CLDR full date.

ExampleToday is {Friday, July 16, 1999}
ICUToday is {var0, date, full}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is Sunday, January 26, 2025
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    Today is Wednesday, September 2, 1998

{10:30 pm} Time Short

Represents a CLDR short time.

ExampleIt's {10:30 pm}
ICUIt's {var0, time, short}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 4:20 pm
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50-07:00"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 8:20 pm

{10:30:45 pm} Time Medium

Represents a CLDR medium time.

ExampleIt's {10:30:45 pm}
ICUIt's {var0, time, medium}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 4:20:50 pm
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50-07:00"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 8:20:50 pm

{10:30:45 pm PDT} Time Long

Represents a CLDR long time.

ExampleIt's {10:30:45 pm PDT}
ICUIt's {var0, time, long}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 4:20:50 pm UTC
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50-07:00"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 8:20:50 pm PDT

{10:30:45 pm Pacific Daylight Time} Time Full

Represents a CLDR full time.

ExampleIt's {10:30:45 pm Pacific Daylight Time}
ICUIt's {var0, time, full}
  • {"var0": "2025-01-26T16:20:50Z"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 4:20:50 pm UTC
  • {"var0": "1998-09-02T20:20:50-07:00"}
    ‚Üí
    It's 8:20:50 pm Pacific Daylight Time

{$1} Currency

Represents an amount of money.

ExampleThe price is {$1}
ICUThe price is {var0, number, ::currency/auto}
  • {"var0": {"currency": "USD", "amount": 12.99}}
    ‚Üí
    The price is $12.99
  • TIK's magic constants (and any of their variants) are case insensitive.
  • ICU Message Format
